intro: Gamocarpha selliana var. multicaulis, commonly known as the multicaul gamocarpha, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. It features a compact, bushy growth habit with multiple stems arising from the base. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the summer months.
